intro: Turrita stricta, commonly known as the rigid turricula, is a species of sea snail belonging to the family Turbinidae. It is a small, marine gastropod mollusk that is typically found in shallow coastal waters. The shell of Turrita stricta is characterized by its elongated, conical shape and a smooth, glossy surface. It has a single spiral whorl and a pointed spire, which are typical features of the genus Turrita. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in rocky or sandy substrates.
